summary: President Trump has demanded that Federal Reserve Governor, Lisa Cook, resign from his position as Federal Reserve (FED) under pressure from his administration, accusing her of committing MortGAGE FRAUD. The White House's ADMINISTRATION accuses Cook of committing fraud and has demanded an investigation into her alleged actions. This is part of a larger effort by the White House to increase legal scrutiny on the alleged fraud within the Department of Justice (DOJ) following a series of incidents involving two PROPERTIES PRIMARY RESIDENCES and a Mortgages purchased by the FED. The DOJ has yet to make any charges related to these incidents.

Trump also disclosed significant corporate bond purchases, while the show highlighted Alaska Air’s new loyalty program and a range of equity movers, including a sell‑off in tech stocks and gains in discount retailers like T.J. X. Overall, the segment underscores the intersection of political pressure, monetary policy uncertainty, and corporate activity in shaping market dynamics.
